test_cases.description:
Seated in his usual spot, he appears to be just another ordinary Joe perched on a bar stool, yet his heart silently shatters within him. Despite the deep sadness, he exudes a sense of excitement, his face adorned with a bright smile. Nearby, Carol maintains a pose, serving as a model for Simon. He holds a ballpoint pen poised over the back of a hotel desk blotter, his creativity stifled by the cumbersome cast on his arm. Wrestling with the inconvenience of the cast, he finally resolves to cease struggling. With a surge of remarkable strength, he tears a section from the cast, granting freedom to his hand. An ironic, lion-like roar of liberation escapes him, symbolizing his return to his true self. 

Just then, the door swings open, and Simon steps inside. Meanwhile, Melvin is in the midst of enjoying a room service breakfast. Carol trails behind Simon, her arms loaded with an assortment of hotel soaps, shampoos, and other toiletries. Melvin’s reaction is immediate as he catches sight of her. Carol meets Melvin's gaze. Simon, having completed dialing the phone, hangs up, evidently self-satisfied, and quickly shifts his attention to Carol and Melvin. Carol feels as though a heavy burden has been lifted. Melvin departs, stalking out with determination. Nearby, a car is parked close to a phone booth. Carol approaches Simon, who is in the car, and she hands him a baseball cap. In response, Melvin hangs up the phone. She shakes her head, an expression of resignation and walks away. The door opens, revealing their presence. Simon takes notice of some of his paintings. A look of sympathy crosses Simon's face as he observes Melvin. 

In Melvin's apartment, two digital clocks show a discrepancy of two minutes. He sits motionless in a chair, still fully dressed. A moment passes, and then Simon's whispered voice reaches the air. As Carol unpacks her belongings, she distributes gifts to her mother and Spencer, although it is clear that something still troubles her deeply. As he escorts someone out hastily, she maintains kindness despite having just ended their relationship. Entering the room with Verdell, the dog strains to get closer to Melvin. Simon releases him, allowing Verdell to move toward the door. Abruptly, Verdell halts, jolted by something, and reluctantly proceeds into the apartment building. Melvin stands before Carol's doorbell, staring at it with profound uncertainty.

From an open window, someone is seen reading one of Melvin's books, hesitating for a brief moment before glancing at their watch. Carol, now at her wide-open window, is clad in a comfortable cotton wrap-around dress or bathrobe. She gazes outward to see the convertible parked at the curb and hesitates. Upon entering, she opens the door, and he reaches her side. He considers turning to leave halfway but notices Beverly standing quietly near her door down the hallway, having overheard at least the last portion of their conversation. Carol has never heard anything quite like that before. Melvin, true to form, cannot simply leave things as they are. Carol disappears back into her room, casting a final glance at him. Melvin turns his gaze to focus on the cracked pattern of Carol's kitchen linoleum and hesitates momentarily at the door. As they begin to walk quietly together, Melvin continues with his usual meticulous attention to where he steps. Although there is a noticeable improvement in his stride, he still walks in his distinctive, peculiar manner, conspicuously avoiding stepping on any lines.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: In a hotel room, a heartbroken man named Melvin struggles with his cast while drawing. He finds relief by freeing his hand from the cast, feeling rejuvenated. Simon enters with Carol, who has collected hotel toiletries. After some interaction, Melvin leaves and Carol gives Simon a baseball cap. Later, Carol feels uneasy while unpacking, despite giving gifts to her family. She has recently ended a relationship but remains friendly. Meanwhile, Verdell, a dog, is eager to be near Melvin, and Simon releases him. Melvin eventually approaches Carol's door, hesitant yet determined. He is buzzed into her life, and despite being tempted to leave, he stays. Their interaction is overheard by Beverly, and Carol is taken aback by Melvin's words. Melvin awkwardly navigates the linoleum floor as they walk, avoiding stepping on the lines, yet showing slight improvement in his demeanor.
